intro: Dioscorea apurimacensis, commonly known as the Apurímac yam, is a species of vine native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the Dioscoreaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers and is often found in humid, forested areas. Its tubers are sometimes used in traditional medicine and local cuisine. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
